definition: a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]

sentences.english: He spent a lot of money in satisfying the appetite for excitement and amusement.
sentences.chinese: 他花钱如水，以求满足兴奋和欢娱的欲望。

sentences.english: And binding with briars my joys & desires.
sentences.chinese: 用波折绑缚着我的欢娱和欲望。

sentences.english: Still it makes for a bit of hilarity in the tent every morning.
sentences.chinese: 不过，每天早晨穿衣服还是制造了一点小小的欢娱。
当忆酷夏兮，鸡尾酒会欢娱。

sentences.english: Who marrieth for love without money, hath good nights and sorry days.
sentences.chinese: 为了爱情，无钱结婚，夜来欢娱，白天悔恨。

sentences.english: Ay, I knew your joy and your pain.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我知道你们的欢娱与惆怅。

sentences.english: My feast of joy is but a dish of pain.
sentences.chinese: 我的锦食欢娱，也只是一碟惆怅。

sentences.english: I because of in yours bosom but enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 我因在你的怀中而欢娱。

definition: fine time, beautiful scenery (idiom); everything lovely
the pleasure of close intimacy in a couple (idiom)/sexual intercourse
lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
to have cordial relations with each other/to have sexual intercourse
to indulge in something to one's heart's content/wanton or willful
scenes of springtime/the radiance of spring/(fig.) a sight of sth sexy or erotic/an indication of a love affair
overwhelmed (with joy, sorrow etc)/to feel transported
